movies.title: Nobel's Last Will
movies.plot: At the Nobel Banquet reporter Annika Bengtzon is witness to the attempted murder of a nobel laureate and murder of a scientist. A terrorist group from Germany takes the credit. As Annika digs further into the events surrounding that night, all is not what it seems.
movies.simplePlot: At the Nobel Banquet reporter Annika Bengtzon is witness to the attempted murder of a nobel laureate and murder of a scientist. A terrorist group from Germany takes the credit. As Annika ...

biography.bio: Malin Crépin was born on August 22, 1978 in Stockholm, Sweden as Anna Malin Fredrika Thomasdotter Crépin. She is an actress, known for Oslo, 31 août (2011), Nobel's Last Will (2012) and In Your Veins (2009). She is married to Markus Sundström. They have two children.
biography.name: Malin Crépin

biography.bio: Björn Kjellman was born on June 4, 1963 in Östra Grevie, Skåne län, Sweden as John Björn Sture Kjellman. He is an actor, known for Adam & Eva (1997), Breaking Out (1999) and Pelle Svanslös (1997). He has been married to Kajsa Aronsson since 1994. They have four children.
biography.name: Björn Kjellman

biography.bio: Leif Andrée was born on January 29, 1958 in Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden as Leif Allan Johansson. He is an actor, known for Kitchen stories - chroniques de cuisine (2003), Daybreak (2003) and Happy Christmas! (1999).
biography.name: Leif Andrée

biography.bio: Kajsa Ernst worked at Nöjesteatern in Malmo and with the infamous Nils Poppe at the Fredriksdals theatre in Helsingborg (both in Sweden) before she became a regular at Helsingborg City Theatre in the end of the 1980s. She stayed with the Helsingborg City Theatre for ten years and did a number of prominent roles there. Kajsa Ernst now lives in Stockholm and can be seen both at the Stockholm City Theatre in the play "Pepparrotslandet" and as the anxious Pauline in the Guldbagge awarded movie "Tomten är far till alla barnen". In autumn 1999 Kajsa Ernst did a role in the much noted TV-series "One Day At A Time" in an episode about anxiety attacks.
biography.name: Kajsa Ernst

biography.bio: Erik Johansson was born on February 23, 1979 as Nils Erik Åkerblom. He is an actor, known for Stockholm Boogie (2005), Raspberry Boat Refugee (2014) and Julens hjältar (1999).
biography.name: Erik Johansson

biography.bio: Felix Engström was born on September 3, 1968 in Stockholm, Stockholms län, Sweden. He is an actor, known for Svensson Svensson (1994), Nobel's Last Will (2012) and Brott§våg (2000). He has been married to Lydia since 2013.
biography.name: Felix Engström

biography.bio: Richard Ulfsäter was born in Helsingborg, southern Sweden. Immediately after birth his parents moved to London, England. Richard attended school in Surrey and at the age of fifteen returned to Sweden for the last years of A-level studies. After graduating, Richard spent one year in Munich, Germany, learning German and one year in Toulouse, France, learning French. He is fluent in Swedish, English (RP), French and German. During his years abroad Richard developed an interest in performing arts and decided to go to drama school. Having graduated from 'Scenstudion' in Stockholm, lead by Matthew Allen from the Neighbourhood Playhouse NY, he began getting work in TV and film. His breakthrough came with the comedy series Playa Del Sol (2007) and the feature film Darling (2007), voted 2010 for best film since the millennium shift. Richard resides in Stockholm and London.
biography.name: Richard Ulfsäter

biography.bio: Antje Traue was born in Mittweida, Saxony, East Germany. Her mother was a musician and dancer. Traue was raised speaking Russian. She discovered her love for acting at an early age. As a teenager, Traue attended the "International Munich Art Lab", where she was cast in the lead role in the theatre play, "West End Opera". For four years, she toured with the ensemble cast throughout Europe and then to New York. In 2002, Traue moved to Berlin and landed roles in both feature films and television projects, including Kleinruppin forever (2004), Berlin am Meer (2008) and Phantom Pain (2009). In 2008, she was cast as the female lead in the international science fiction film, Pandorum (2009), opposite Dennis Quaid and Ben Foster. In 2010, she was filming on Renny Harlin's 5 Days of War (2011), alongside Val Kilmer and Rupert Friend.
biography.name: Antje Traue

biography.bio: Per Graffman was born on November 5, 1962. He is an actor, known for Before the Storm (2000), Talismanen (2003) and Inga tårar (2006). He has been married to Johanna Hammar since August 2002. They have two children.
biography.name: Per Graffman

biography.bio: Björn Granath was born on April 5, 1946 in Gothenburg, Västra Götalands län, Sweden as Björn Gösta Tryggve Granath. He was an actor, known for The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo (2009), The American (2010) and Pelle the Conqueror (1987). He was married to Annmargret Fyregård. He died on February 5, 2017 in Stockholm, Sweden.
biography.name: Björn Granath

biography.bio: Ia Langhammer was born on August 13, 1962 in Stockholm, Sweden. She is an actress, known for Mother of Mine (2005), Un été suédois (2009) and LasseMajas detektivbyrå (2006).
biography.name: Ia Langhammer

biography.bio: Karl Linnertorp is an actor, known for Four Shades of Brown (2004), Simon & the Oaks (2011) and Buss till Italien (2005).
biography.name: Karl Linnertorp

biography.bio: Anna von Rosen was born on February 17, 1956. She is an actress, known for Sunes sommar (1993), The Last Gasp (1995) and Nobel's Last Will (2012).
biography.name: Anna von Rosen

biography.bio: Johan Holmberg is an actor, known for The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest (2009), Hallåhallå (2014) and She Is Dead (2002).
biography.name: Johan Holmberg

biography.bio: Pia Johansson was born on November 16, 1960 in Umeå, Västerbottens län, Sweden. She is an actress, known for The Dream Prince (1996), Agnes (2001) and La veuve tatouée (1998).
biography.name: Pia Johansson

filmingLocations.location: Nacka strand, Nacka, Stockholms län, Sweden
